intro: Pavetta kabarensis, commonly known as the Kivu pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
